citation.article-title: Larkinella bovis sp. nov., isolated from fermented bovine products, and emended descriptions of the genus Larkinella and of Larkinella insperata Vancanneyt et al. 2006
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Larkinella Vancanneyt et al. 2006
The description remains as given by Vancanneyt et al. (2006) with the following additions.
The predominant polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylserine, two unidentified aminophospholipids and two unidentified polar lipids.
The DNA G+C content is 52–53 mol%.
The genus is a member of the family Cytophagaceae, phylum Bacteroidetes.
